intro: Cacalia coriacea, commonly known as the rough cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called achenes. Cacalia coriacea is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
